# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` that wraps text based on the specified `text_width`. The function iterates over words and inserts newline characters when the next word would exceed the `text_width`.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    wrapped = ""
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped *= line * "\n"
            line = ""
        end
        if isempty(line)
            line = word
        else
            line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    if !isempty(line)
        wrapped *= line
    end

    return wrapped
end

# Example usage
text = "Julia is a high-performance, high-level programming language."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function is called with a `text_width` of 15. It will produce output like:

```
Julia is a
high-performance,
high-level
programming
language.
```
